com.bigdata.journal

Class CommitCounterUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.journal.CommitCounterUtility

  • public class CommitCounterUtility
extends Object
    Utility class for operations on files that are named using a commit counter.

    The commit counter based files are arranged in a heirarchial directory structure with 3 digits per directory and 7 directory levels. These levels are labeled with depths [0..6]. The root directory is at depth ZERO (0). Each directory contains up to 1000 children. The children in the non-leaf directories are subdirectories labeled 0..999. The leaf directories are at depth SIX (6). Leaf directories contain files. Each file in a leaf directory is labeled with a 21 digit base name and some purpose specific file extension. Each such file has data for the specific commit point encoded by the basename of the file.

    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • getBasenameDigits

        public static int getBasenameDigits()
        The #of digits (21) in the base file name for a commit counter as formatted by getCommitCounterStr(long).

        Note: 21 := (leafDirDepth+1) * digitsPerDir

      • getDigitsPerDirectory

        public static int getDigitsPerDirectory()
        The number of base-10 digits per directory level ( ). This allows children having labels 000...999. Thus there are 1000 children per directory.

      • getFilesPerDirectory

        The number of files per directory ().

      • getCommitCounterFile

        public static File getCommitCounterFile(File dir,
                        long commitCounter,
                        String ext)
        Return the name of the File associated with the commitCounter.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory spanning all such files.
        commitCounter - The commit counter for the current root block on the journal.
        ext - The filename extension.
        Returns:
        The name of the corresponding snapshot file.

      • getCommitCounterStr

        public static String getCommitCounterStr(long commitCounter)
        Format the commit counter with leading zeros such that it will be lexically ordered in the file system.
        Parameters:
        commitCounter - The commit counter.
        Returns:
        The basename of the file consisting of the foramtted commit counter with the appropriate leading zeros.

      • parseCommitCounterFile

        public static long parseCommitCounterFile(String name,
                          String ext)
                                   throws NumberFormatException
        Parse out the commitCounter from the file name.
        Parameters:
        name - The file name
        ext - The expected file extension.
        Returns:
        The commit counter from the file name.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either argument is null
        NumberFormatException - if the file name can not be interpreted as a commit counter.

      • getBaseName

        public static String getBaseName(String name,

        Return the basename of the file (strip off the extension).
        Parameters:
        name - The file name.
        ext - The extension.
        Returns:
        The base name of the file without the extension.

      • recursiveDelete

        public static void recursiveDelete(boolean errorIfDeleteFails,
                   File f,
                   FileFilter fileFilter)
                            throws IOException
        Recursively removes any files and subdirectories and then removes the file (or directory) itself. Only files recognized by #getFileFilter() will be deleted.

        Note: A dedicated version of this method exists here to thrown an IOException if we can not delete a file. This is deliberate. It is thrown to prevent a REBUILD from proceeding unless we can clear out the old snapshot and HALog files.

        Parameters:
        errorIfDeleteFails - When true and IOException is thrown if a file matching the filter or an empty directory matching the filter can not be removed. When false, that event is logged @ WARN instead.
        f - A file or directory.
        fileFilter - A filter matching the files and directories to be visited and removed. If directories are matched, then they will be removed iff they are empty. A depth first visitation is used, so the files and sub-directories will be cleared before we attempt to remove the parent directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any file or non-empty directory can not be deleted (iff errorIfDeleteFails is true).

      • findGreatestCommitCounter

        public static File findGreatestCommitCounter(File f,
                             FileFilter fileFilter)
                                      throws IOException
        Find and return the File associated with the greatest commit counter. This uses a reverse order search to locate the most recent file very efficiently.
        Parameters:
        f - The root of the directory structure for the snapshot or HALog files.
        fileFilter - Either the SnapshotManager#SNAPSHOT_FILTER or the IHALogReader.HALOG_FILTER.
        Returns:
        The file from the directory structure associated with the greatest commit counter.
        Throws:
        IOException
